poem:
**Scramble for the World**

In markets' shadows,  
a clang of metal resonates—  
tariffs rise like dawn.  
Sixty nations  
shuffle their feet,  
seeking solace  
between the cracks of  
a fractured globe.  
Jobs hover, like whispered promises,  
on the precipice.  
Coins cling to pockets,  
undaunted by borders—  
a rusted dance,  
an uneven sidestep.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "More than 60 countries scramble to respond to Trump’s latest tariffs More than 60 countries around the world are scrambling to respond to the latest wave of US tariffs announced by Donald Trump, which came into force on Thursday. Industry representatives in rich and poor countries warned of job losses as the tariffs upended a decades-old world trading system with rates ranging from 10% to 39%, 40% and 41% for Switzerland, Brazil and Syria. All". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: More than 60 countries scramble to respond to Trump’s latest tariffs More than 60 countries around the world are scrambling to respond to the latest wave of US tariffs announced by Donald Trump, which came into force on Thursday. Industry representatives in rich and poor countries warned of job losses as the tariffs upended a decades-old world trading system with rates ranging from 10% to 39%, 40% and 41% for Switzerland, Brazil and Syria.
